Detailed Description

A timer can be started, stopped, resumed and restarted. It has a timeout-value, which fires a timer-message after exceeding. A timer always belongs to an application and may not be shared.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Timer::Timer (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

BOOLEAN  autotimer = FALSE
) 
 

Parameters:
timeout Timeout in milliseconds.
autotimer If TRUE, the timer will be restarted automatically after expiring.

Reimplemented in SharedTimer.

BOOLEAN Timer::IsActive (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the status (running or not) of the timer.

void Timer::OnTimer (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if the timout-value of the timer expired. In the default implementation of this method the message TimerTimeoutMsg is sent.

Reimplemented in LcsRepeatTimer, LcsTimer, TriggerTimer< T >, EditBoxBlinkTimer, Animation, EditBoxPagingTimer, SharedTriggerTimer< T >, TriggerTimer< ImageBox >, TriggerTimer< SocketTestProgressWin >, TriggerTimer< MultiTapInputMapper >, TriggerTimer< SvgPlayer >, TriggerTimer< DefaultCaret >, TriggerTimer< AbstractItemGrid >, TriggerTimer< AnimatedTextLine >, TriggerTimer< SocketTestApp >, TriggerTimer< ItemBox >, TriggerTimer< TimeoutCondition >, and TriggerTimer< FfsTestDispWin >.

void Timer::SetTimeout (  UINT32  timeout  ) 
 

Specifies the timeout-value, until the timer expires. After exceeding OnTimer is invoked.

void Timer::Start (   ) 
 

Starts the timer.

Reimplemented in LcsRepeatTimer, LcsTimer, Animation, and SharedTimer.

UINT32 Timer::Stop (   ) 
 

Stops the timer and returns the remaining time to the expiration of the timer (in milliseconds)

Reimplemented in AudioActiveReference, and SharedTimer.
